Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Belton, M.J.S., K.J. Meech, M.F. A'Hearn, O. Groussin, L. McFadden, C. Lisse, Y.R. Fernandez, J. Pittachova, H. Hsieh, J. Kissel, K. Klaasen, P. Lamy, D. Hsieh, H.H., D. Jewitt, and M. Ishiguro, Physical properties of main-belt comet P/2005 U1 (READ), Astron. J., 137,157-168, 2009.

Kelley, M.S., D.H. Wooden, C. Tubiana, H. Boehnhardt, C.E. Woodward, and D.E. Harker, Spitzer observations of comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko at 5.5-4.3 AU from the sun, Astron. J., 137, 4633-4642, 2009.

Knight, M.M., M.F. A'Hearn, D.A. Biesecker, G. Faury, D.P. Hamilton, P. Lamy, and A. Llebaria, Photometric Study of the Kreutz Comets Observed by SOHO from 1996 to 2005, Astron. J., 139, 926-949, 2010.

Lamy, P.L., I. Toth, Y.R. Fernandez, and H.A. Weaver, The Sizes, Shapes, Albedos, and Colors of Cometary Nuclei, in 'Comets II', edited by M.C. Festou et al., pp. 223-264, University of Arizona Press, Tucson, in collaboration with the Lunar and Planetary Institute, Houston, 2004.

Lamy, P.L., I. Toth, O. Groussin, L. Jorda, M.S. Kelley, and J.A. Stansberry, Spitzer Space Telescope observations of the nucleus of comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko, Astron. Astrophys., 489, 777-785, 2008.

Lamy, P.L., I. Toth, H.A. Weaver, M.F. A'Hearn, and L. Jorda, Properties of the nuclei and comae of 13 ecliptic comets from Hubble Space Telescope snapshot observations, Astron. Astrophys., 508, 1045-1056, 2009.

Lamy, P.L., I. Toth, H.A. Weaver, M.F. A'Hearn, and L. Jorda, Properties of the nuclei and comae of 10 ecliptic comets from Hubble Space Telescope multi-orbit observations, Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 1-21, 2010.
Lowry, S.C., and A. Fitzsimmons, William Herschel Telescope observations of distant comets, Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 358, 641-650, 2005.
Lowry, S.C., and P.R. Weissman, Rotation and color properties of the nucleus of Comet 2P/Encke, Icarus, 188, 212-223, 2007.
Snodgrass, C., A. Fitzsimmons, and S.C. Lowry, The nuclei of comets 7P/Pons-Winnecke, 14P/Wolf and 92P/Sanguin, Astron. Astrophys., 444, 287-295, 2005.
Snodgrass, C., S.C. Lowry, and A. Fitzsimmons, Photometry of cometary nuclei: Rotation rates, colours and a comparison with Kuiper Belt Objects, Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 373, 1590-1602, 2006.

Snodgrass, C., S.C. Lowry, and A. Fitzsimmons, Optical observations of 23 distant Jupiter Family Comets, including 36P/Whipple at multiple phase angles, Mon. Not. R. Astron. Soc., 385, Iss.2, 737-756, 2008.
Snodgrass, C., K. Meech, and O. Hainaut, The nucleus of 103P/Hartley 2, target of the EPOXI mission, Astron. Astrophys., 516, 2010.

Stansberry, J.A., J. Van Cleve, W.T. Reach, D.P. Cruikshank, J.P. Emery, Y.R. Fernandez, V.S. Meadows, K.Y.L. Su, K. Misselt, G.H. Rieke, E.T. Young, M.W. Werner, C.W. Engelbracht, K.D. Gordon, D.C. Hines, D.M. Kelly, J.E. Morrison, and J. Muzerolle, Spitzer Observations of the Dust coma and Nucleus of 29P/Schwassmann-Wachmann 1, Astron. J. Supp. Ser., 154, 463-468, 2004.
Tubiana, C., L. Barrera, M. Drahus, and H. Boehnhardt, Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko at a large heliocentric distance, Astron. Astrophys., 490, 377-386, 2008.

Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Barnes, T.F., M.F. A'Hearn, and L. Kolokolova, Eds., PROPERTIES OF COMET NUCLEI, EAR-C-COMPIL-5-COMET-NUC-PROPERTIES-V2.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 2012.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: This data set contains size, shape, albedo and color data for various comets collected from the papers listed in the DATA_SET_DESC below.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= Sizes, shapes, colors and albedos of comet nuclei culled from the literature as presented in the following papers:
Belton et al. (2004) Boehnhardt et al. (2008) Hsieh et al. (2009) Kelley et al. (2009) Knight et al. (2010) Lamy et al. (2004, 2008,2009, 2010) Lowry and Fitzsimmons (2005) Lowry and Weissman (2007) Snodgrass et al. (2005, 2006, 2008, 2010) Stansberry et al. (2004) Tubiana et al. (2008)
Parameters ========== Measurements of effective radius, axial ratio and period are presented for 164 comets and 35 asteroidal objects suspected of being dormant or extinct comet nuclei. Additional tables present colors, albedos, and dimensions of nuclei.
In most cases of shapes determined from light curves (all but the 4 space mission targets), the values of one axis or another are limits. In particular, generally one measures a lower limit to the ratio a/b (and usually assumes c=b unless there are observations at many different phases), plus a product of a and b. This pretty much means a lower limit on a and an upper limit on b.
Processing ========== These data have been keyed in to flat ASCII tables from the published paper. The format has been modified slightly to accommodate PDS standards, usual SBN practices, and the preferences of users as expressed by the external reviewers.
Modification History =================== Version 2.0 of this data set includes the addition of more recent data since version 1.0 was released in 2005 and corrects typographical errors in comet names, discovery IDs, and references used in several data products.
Media/Format ============ These data are available online for immediate downloading.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Confidence Level Overview ========================= The papers whose data have been included in this dataset contain extensive remarks regarding the various observations and measurements included in these tables. While the tables present an excellent summary of the state of knowledge, the user is strongly encouraged to consult the published paper for the various caveats and notations included in the remarks.
